div.p: POSSIBLE FREE INTERNET FOR STUDENTS!!Â Â

span.span: PARENTS â€“Â Please send any concerns orÂ questions you may have about CISD and our efforts related to the Coronavirus to the following email address:Â COVID-19@clarksvilleisd.org.Â This email is being monitored by the Superintendent.

p.span: A note from the Superintendent:Â March 31, 2020

span.span: The Presidential address to the country over the weekend sort of ran all schools all over the country into closing at least for the rest of April. With that being said, we will extend our closure thru Friday, May 1.Â CISD continues to refine the processes that we have recently developed for student instruction online and via student packets. I say that to prepare you to expect and even embrace the changes and adjustments that we will certainly make.Â We are posting an updated grading policy for both campuses on our facebook and website.Â

Thank you for helping us adhere to the social distancing requested by our nationâ€™s leaders and the current curfew by our local leaders.Â It will take us as a whole, working together, to see our lives return to a normal place in the future.

div.button:
Severe Thunderstorm Warning
Click for more Information

div.style: background-color:#ecdddd !important; border: 3px solid #d9534f !important;
color:#d9534f !important;
div.p: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern McCurtain County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Bowie County in northeastern Texas... Central Red River County in northeastern Texas... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 409 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located just west of Clarksville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Avery, Annona, English, Tom, Almont, Beaverdams and Goodlake. HAIL...1.00IN WIND...<50MPH
